Juventus have rejected a bid from Chelsea for left-back Alex Sandro, according to the Serie A club's general director Giuseppe Marotta.

"We said no to a very good offer from Chelsea for Alex Sandro.

"I do not know how Alex Sandro reacted."

The Anfield club were rebuffed in a £28m offer for the former Chelsea player earlier this month, according to Sky in Italy.

Salah has reportedly already agreed terms with Liverpool after meeting with boss Jurgen Klopp.

Sky sources in Italy said on Saturday that an improved bid for Salah was expected this weekend, and should agreement be reached a medical could happen as early as Tuesday.

Salah was originally linked with Brendan Rodgers' Liverpool before moving to Chelsea from FC Basel for £11m in January 2014.

Salah has reportedly already agreed terms with Liverpool

He would go on to make only 19 appearances for the Stamford Bridge club and had spells on loan with Fiorentina and Roma, who he joined on a permanent deal in August 2016.

Salah was a regular starter as Roma finished runners-up to Juventus last season, scoring 15 goals in 31 league appearances.

The Anfield club were rebuffed in a £28m offer for the former Chelsea player earlier this month, according to Sky in Italy.

Salah has reportedly already agreed terms with Liverpool after meeting with boss Jurgen Klopp.

Sky sources in Italy said on Saturday that an improved bid for Salah was expected this weekend, and should agreement be reached a medical could happen as early as Tuesday.

Salah was originally linked with Brendan Rodgers' Liverpool before moving to Chelsea from FC Basel for £11m in January 2014.

Salah has reportedly already agreed terms with Liverpool

He would go on to make only 19 appearances for the Stamford Bridge club and had spells on loan with Fiorentina and Roma, who he joined on a permanent deal in August 2016.

Salah was a regular starter as Roma finished runners-up to Juventus last season, scoring 15 goals in 31 league appearances.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang is open to joining Liverpool this summer, according to Le Parisien in France.

The paper claims Aubameyang is eager to link up with former Borussia Dortmund boss Jurgen Klopp, now in charge at Anfield.

And they say Liverpool are willing to pay the £61m it would take to prise the striker from Dortmund.

Klopp signed Aubameyang when Dortmund manager in 2013 and the forward has since scored more than 100 goals for the club.
